If the perimeter of a rectangle is $ p$ and its diagonal is $ d$, the difference between the length and width of the rectangle is:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \frac {\sqrt {8d^2 - p^2}}{2} \qquad\textbf{(B)}\ \frac {\sqrt {8d^2 + p^2}}{2} \qquad\textbf{(C)}\ \frac {\sqrt {6d^2 - p^2}}{2}$\\
$ \textbf{(D)}\ \frac {\sqrt {6d^2 + p^2}}{2} \qquad\textbf{(E)}\ \frac {8d^2 - p^2}{4}$
